grid.text: Kayō ni sōro mono wa Inari Daimyōjin ni tsukaemōsu massha no shin nite sōro.
Tadaima kore eh izuru koto, yomo gi ni arazu. Satemo, ninnō Rokujūrokudai Ichijō no in,
kono hodo, fushigi no ontsuge mashimashite, Sanjō no Kokaji Munechika ni,
mitsurugi wo utaserarubeki to no on koto nari. Sunawachi Michinari nōkyō, chokushi to natte,
Munechika, senji uketemawari, kahodo daiji no mitsurugi wo, uchimōsu ni wa,
Ware ni otoranu aizuchi nakute wa kanawaji tote,
mazu wa gojitai nasaresōrō ga ringen nase nogotoshi,
katsu wa ie no menboku to zonji, ouke wo mōsoresōro.
Sarinagara, kono tabi no mitsurugi wo uchimōsuni wa,
Soregashi ichinin wa, hakaraigatashi, Shinriki wo tanomōruru tote,
sunawachi, Inari Daimyōjin na ujishin nari.
Koto sara, kaji wo mamori tamao ongami nareba,
tadaima sankei tsukamatsuri sōro. Tokoro no. Katajikenakumo tosha myojin gozonji atte
kari ni dōji no sugata to genji Munechika ni uchiai, on-kotoba wo kawasaresōro.
Sōjite, wagakyō ni oite, kamiyo yori tsutōru reiken, futatsu ari.
Totsuka no Tsurugi to mōsu wa, Susanō nomikoto,
Izumo no kuni, Hi no kawakami ni, daijya no arishi wo,
Tsukamaetamaishimo, kono tsurugi no itoku nari.
Matta, Murakumo no tsurugi to mōsu wa, sono toki daijya no wo ni arishi tsurugi nari.
Matta, ninō junidai Keikō tenno, daini no miko
Yamatodake no mikoto tōi wo tairagetamaishi wo, sono tsurugi no itoku nari.
Sore yori aratame, Kusanagi no tsurugi to wa, kore wo mōsu nari.
Sono hoka, Kan no kōsō Sanseki no ken,
Kan Shō Bakuga no tsurugi, morokoshi wagakyo ni oite
tsurugi no itoku, kotogotoku onmonogatari nasare.
Nonji mo, na wo ehtaru kaji nareba, izure ni ototoru
Mitsurugi wo uchimōsu nari. Kane wo kitōte matsubeshi.
Sono toki myojin raigenatte, Aizuchi wo utaserarubeki to no onkoto nareba,
Munechika mo, yorokobi no mayu wo hiraki, tadaima, gekō tsukamatsurite sōrō.
Sōjite nanigoto mo kisei wo kakemōseba, shōganjōju utagai nashi.
Two steps back, turn and leave.

captions.translation: [KYŌGEN] I am the god of a subsidiary shrine
captions.transcription: [KYŌGEN] Kayō ni sorō mono wa Inari daimyōjin ni
captions.japaneseScript: 斯様に候者は、稲荷大明神に

captions.translation: and in the service of Inari-daimyōjin.
captions.transcription: tsukaemōsu massha no shin nite sōro.
captions.japaneseScript: 仕へ申す末社の神にて候。

captions.translation: I have come here before you now on a matter of no small importance.
captions.transcription: Tadaima kore e izuru koto, yonogi ni arazu.
captions.japaneseScript: 只今是へ出ずること、余の義にあらず

captions.translation: Now then, it seems that the Emperor Ichijo, sixty-sixth of the imperial line,
captions.transcription: Satemo, ninnō rokujūrokudai Ichijō no in,
captions.japaneseScript: さても、人皇六十六代一條院

captions.translation: has recently had a portentous dream oracle.
captions.transcription: Kono hodo, fushigi no ontsuge mashimashite,
captions.japaneseScript: この程不思議の御告げましまして

captions.translation: According to it, the Sanjo swordsmith Munechika,
captions.transcription: Sanjō no Kokaji Munechika ni,
captions.japaneseScript: 三条の小鍛冶宗近に、

captions.translation: must be ordered to forge a blade.
captions.transcription: mitsurugi wo utaserarubeki to no on koto nari.
captions.japaneseScript: 御剣を打たせらるべきとの御事なり。

captions.translation: At that time Minister Michinari was the imperial envoy
captions.transcription: Sunawachi Michinari nokyō, chokushi to natte,
captions.japaneseScript: すなわち道成卿、勅使となって

captions.translation: who gave him the details of the imperial message.
captions.transcription: senji no omomuki, ōserare kereba,
captions.japaneseScript: 宣旨の趣き仰られければ、

captions.translation: Munechika hearing the message, agreed to comply with the order,
captions.transcription: Munechika, senji uketamawari
captions.japaneseScript: 宗近宣旨承り

captions.translation: though to forge such an important blade,
captions.transcription: kahodo daiji no mitsurugi wo, uchimōsu ni wa,
captions.japaneseScript: いか程大事に御剣を打ち申すには、

captions.translation: he said, was something he could not do by himself
captions.transcription: soregashi ichinin nite wa hakaraigatashi.
captions.japaneseScript: それがし一人にては計らいがたし。

captions.translation: "As it will be impossible without an assistant of skill equal to my own,
captions.transcription: Ware ni otoranu aizuchi nakute wa kanawaji tote,
captions.japaneseScript: われに劣らぬ相槌無くては叶わじとて、

captions.translation: I should certainly refuse this order, but as this is a request from the Emperor himself,
captions.transcription: mazu wa gojitai nasaresōrō ga ringen nase no gotoshi,
captions.japaneseScript: 先ずはご辞退なされ候が、綸言汗の如し、

captions.translation: I know it would bring great shame to my house to decline and so I will accept it," he said.
captions.transcription: katsu wa ie no menboku to zonji, ouke wo mōsoresōro.
captions.japaneseScript: 且つは家の面目と存じ、お受けを申され候。

captions.translation: And so, as it would not be possible for him to forge the sword by himslef on this occasion,
captions.transcription: Sarinagara, kono tabi no mitsurugi wo uchimōsuni wa
captions.japaneseScript: さりながら、この度の御剣を打ち申すには、

captions.translation: in order to do it he decided he must call on divine power,
captions.transcription: soregashi ichinin nite wa hakaraigatashi,
captions.japaneseScript: それがし一人にては計らいがたし、神力を頼もうずるとて、

captions.translation: in other words, on Inari Daimyojin, his family's tutelary god.
captions.transcription: shinriki ō tanomōzuru-tote,
captions.japaneseScript: 神力を頼もうずるとて、

captions.translation: If indeed a deity could watch over his forge,
captions.transcription: sunawachi, Inari daimyojin na ujishin nari
captions.japaneseScript: すなわち稲荷大明神は氏神なり。

captions.translation: he decided he must go at once and pray concerning the matter.
captions.transcription: Koto sara, kaji o mamori tamao ongami nareba,
captions.japaneseScript: ことさら鍛治を守り給う御神なれば、

captions.translation: As he did this so humbly, the god of the Inari shrine knew of it and,
captions.transcription: tadaima sankei tsukamatsuri sōro. Tokoro ni,
captions.japaneseScript: 只今参詣仕り候う所に

captions.translation: taking the form of a youth, appeared and met
captions.transcription: katajikenakumo tōsha myojin gozonji atte
captions.japaneseScript: 忝くも当社明神ご存じあって、

captions.translation: with Munechika, and spoke to him.
captions.transcription: kari ni dōji no sugata to Genji Munechika ni uchiai,
captions.japaneseScript: 仮に童子の姿と現じ、宗近に行き合い、

captions.translation: Commonly, in our land there have been,
captions.transcription: on-kotoba wo kawasaresōro.
captions.japaneseScript: 御言葉を交わされ候

captions.translation: from the Age of the Gods, two sacred swords.
captions.transcription: Sōjite, wagakyō ni oite,
captions.japaneseScript: 総じて我が朝において、

captions.translation: The one called "Totsuka no Tsurugi", the Ten-span Sword
captions.transcription: kamiyo yori tsutōru reiken, futatsu ari.
captions.japaneseScript: 神代より伝うる霊剣、二つあり

captions.translation: was used by Susanō-no-mikoto, when learning of the great serpent
captions.transcription: Totsuka no Tsurugi to mōsu wa, Susanō-no-mikoto,
captions.japaneseScript: 十束の剣と申すは、須佐之男命

captions.translation: at the headwaters of the Hi River in the country of Izumo,
captions.transcription: Izumo no kuni, Hi no Kawakami ni, daijya no arishi wo,
captions.japaneseScript: 出雲の国、斐の川上に大蛇のありしを

captions.translation: he destroyed it, due to the virtue of this sword.
captions.transcription: tsukamaetamaishimo, kono tsurugi no itoku nari.
captions.japaneseScript: 従え給いしも この剣の威徳なり

captions.translation: Then again, the sword called "Murakumo no Tsurugi" the Gathering Clouds Sword,
captions.transcription: Matta, Murakumo no Tsurugi to mōsu wa,
captions.japaneseScript: 又、叢雲の剣と申すは、

captions.translation: was the sword he found at that time in the tail of the great serpent.
captions.transcription: sono toki daijya no ō ni arishi tsurugi nari.
captions.japaneseScript: そのとき大蛇の尾にありし剣なり

captions.translation: Then again, Yamatodake-no-mikoto the second son of Emperor Keikō,
captions.transcription: Matta, ninō junidai Keikō tenno, daini no miko
captions.japaneseScript: 又、人皇十二代景行天皇第二の皇子

captions.translation: the twelfth of the imperial line, subdued the people of the eastern lands,
captions.transcription: Yamatodake-no-mikoto tōi wo tairagetamaishi mo,
captions.japaneseScript: 日本武尊命、東夷を平らげ給いしも、

captions.translation: this also due to the virtue of that sword.
captions.transcription: sono tsurugi no itoku nari.
captions.japaneseScript: その剣の威徳なり

captions.translation: From that time, it was renamed and known as 'Kusanagi-no-Tsurugi" the Grass Cutting Sword.
captions.transcription: Sore yori aratame, Kusanagi-no-tsurugi to wa, kore ō mōsu nari.
captions.japaneseScript: それよりあらため、草薙の剣とはこれを申すなり

captions.translation: In addition to these, there are the Han Emperor's Three Foot Sword,
captions.transcription: Sono hoka, Kan no kōsō sanseki no ken,
captions.japaneseScript: そのほか、漢の高祖、三尺の剣

captions.translation: the Gan JIang and Mo Ye swords. He told him many stories
captions.transcription: Kan shō bakuga no tsurugi, morokoshi wagakyō ni oite
captions.japaneseScript: 干将莫耶の剣、唐土我が朝において

captions.translation: of the virtue of swords, both in China and in our own country.
captions.transcription: tsurugi no itoku, kotogotoku onmonogatari nasare.
captions.japaneseScript: 剣の威徳ことごとく、御物語なされ

captions.translation: "You, too, if you are a swordsmith of repute, will be able to forge a blade of equal merit.
captions.transcription: Nanji mo, na wo ehtaru kaji nareba, izure ni ototoru
captions.japaneseScript: 汝も名を得たる鍛治なれば、いずれにおとさる（劣らざる）

captions.translation: Prepare, temper the metal, and wait."
captions.transcription: Mitsurugi wo uchimōsu nari. Kane wo kitōte matsubeshi.
captions.japaneseScript: 御剣を打ち申すなり 鉄を鍛うて待つべし

captions.translation: At that time, Myojin will appear and be your assistant
captions.transcription: Sono toki myojin raigenatte,
captions.japaneseScript: その時明神来現あって、

captions.translation: in forging the blade. This being the case,
captions.transcription: aizuchi wo utaserarubeki to no onkoto nareba,
captions.japaneseScript: 相槌を打たせらるべきとの、御事なれば

captions.translation: Munechika, his eyebrows relaxed in joy,
captions.transcription: Munechika mo, yorokobi no mayu wo hiraki,
captions.japaneseScript: 宗近も喜びの眉をひらき、

captions.translation: is even now coming this way to do these things.
captions.transcription: tadaima, gekō tsukamatsurite sōrō.
captions.japaneseScript: 只今、下向仕りて候

captions.translation: In this way then, whe prayers are offered
captions.transcription: Sōjite nanigoto mo kisei wo kakemōseba,
captions.japaneseScript: 総じて何事も、祈請をかけ申せば、

captions.translation: they shall be fulfilled, without a doubt.
captions.transcription: shōganjōju utagai nashi.
captions.japaneseScript: 諸願成就疑いなし

captions.translation: On this matter, rest assured,
captions.transcription: Kamaete sono bun, kokoroe-sōrae.
captions.japaneseScript: かまえてその分心得候え

captions.translation: rest assured.
captions.transcription: kokoroe-sōrae.
captions.japaneseScript: 心得候え
